title: IPTC ninjs - News in JSON - version 2.1.1 (approved at IPTC Standards Committee May 2023)
description: A news item as JSON object -- copyright 2023 IPTC - International Press Telecommunications Council - www.iptc.org - This document is published under the Creative Commons Attribution 4.0 license, see  http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/4.0/

type.description: Type would be method of communication like phone, mobile, address etc.

role.description: Role refers to type and could be private, office etc

lang.description: If this contactinfo object need to be qualified with what language it is in. The value should follow IETF BCP47.

name.description: Human readable name of the contact method, like name for a web page, name of persons twitter account etc

value.description: Actual phone number, email address, web url etc.

address.description: The address of a person, place or organisation.

lines.description: An array of lines to construct an address. The order is important to construct a correct address.

items.description: One line in the lines array.

locality.description: A city/town/village etc. part of the address.

area.description: A subdivision of a country part of the address.

postalcode.description: A postal code part of the address.

country.description: A country part of the address.

ninjsType.description: The root schema of ninjs as a type to make it possible to combine schema parts.

uri.title: Uniform Resource Identifier
uri.description: The global unique identifier for this news object. This is the only required property and should identify the ninjs object, not be used for links to external resources etc.  nar:newsItem@guid

type.title: Type
type.description: The generic news type of this news object. (Value 'component' added in version 1.2 as issue #21.). See: http://cv.iptc.org/newscodes/ninature/ nar:itemClass

representationtype.title: Representation type
representationtype.description: Indicates how complete this representation of a news item is. No mapping to nar. Specific for ninjs.

profile.title: Profile
profile.description: An identifier for the structure of the news object. This can be any string but we suggest something identifying the structure of the content such as 'text-only' or 'text-photo'. Profiles are typically provider-specific. nar:profile

version.title: Version
version.description: The version of the news object which is identified by the uri property. nar:newsItem@version

firstcreated.title: First created
firstcreated.description: Indicates when the first version of this ninjs object was created. (Added in version 1.2 from issue #5). nar:firstCreated

versioncreated.title: Version created
versioncreated.description: The date and time when this version of this ninjs object was created. nar:versionCreated

contentcreated.title: Content created
contentcreated.description: The date and time when the content of this ninjs object was originally created. For example an old photo that is now handled as a ninjs object. nar:contentCreated

embargoed.title: Embargoed
embargoed.description: The date and time before which all versions of the news object are embargoed. If absent, this object is not embargoed. nar:embargoed

pubstatus.title: Publication status
pubstatus.description: The publishing status of the news object, its value is *usable* by default. nar:pubStatus

urgency.title: Urgency
urgency.description: The editorial urgency of the content. Values from 1 to 9. 1 represents the highest urgency, 9 the lowest. nar:urgency

copyrightholder.title: Copyright holder
copyrightholder.description: The person or organisation claiming the intellectual property for the content. nar:copyrightHolder

copyrightnotice.title: Copyright notice
copyrightnotice.description: Any necessary copyright notice for claiming the intellectual property for the content. nar:copyrightNotice

usageterms.title: Usage terms
usageterms.description: A natural-language statement about the usage terms pertaining to the content. nar:usageTerms

ednote.title: Editorial note
ednote.description: A note that is intended to be read by internal staff at the receiving organisation, but not intended to be published. (Added in version 1.2 from issue #6.). (Consider using this before using the descriptions array.) ednote: nar:edNote

language.title: Language
language.description: The human language used by the content. The value should follow IETF BCP47. nar:language

descriptions.title: Descriptions
descriptions.description: An array of one or more descriptions of the ninjs object. See also ednote for information from provider to reciever. Descriptions are seen as metadata. For a simple description use an array with one object only containing the value property. Role and contenttype are then undefined and it is up to the provider.

contenttype.title: Content Type
contenttype.description: The IANA (Internet Assigned Numbers Authority) media type of the content of this description. Used to be called MIME type.

value.title: Value
value.description: The descriptive text identified with the above role (and contenttype).

bodies.title: Bodies
bodies.description: An array of body objects with the content as text or with markup. For a simple body use an array with one object only containing the value property. Role and contenttype are then undefined and it is up to the provider.

contenttype.title: Content Type
contenttype.description: The IANA (Internet Assigned Numbers Authority) media type of the content of this body. Used to be called MIME type.

charcount.title: Character count
charcount.description: The total character count in this body excluding figure captions. (Added in version 1.2 according to issue #27.). nar:charcount

wordcount.title: Word count
wordcount.description: The total number of words in this body excluding figure captions. (Added in version 1.2 according to issue #27.). nar:wordcount

value.title: Value
value.description: The body text identified with the above role and contenttype.

headlines.title: Headlines
headlines.description: An array of objects containing various types of headlines. For a simple headline use an array with one object only containing the value property. Role and contenttype are then undefined and it is up to the provider.

contenttype.title: Content Type
contenttype.description: The IANA (Internet Assigned Numbers Authority) media type of the content of this headline. Used to be called MIME type.

value.title: Value
value.description: The headline identified with the above role and contenttype.

people.title: People
people.description: An array of objects describing individual human beings. nar:subject

rel.title: Relationship
rel.description: The relationship of the content of the news object to the person

uri.title: URI
uri.description: The identifier for the person as a complete uri with the code.

literal.title: Literal
literal.description: An identifier for the person as a free-text string.

organisations.title: Organisations
organisations.description: An array of objects describing administrative and functional structures which may, for example, act as a business, as a political party or not-for-profit party. nar:subject

rel.title: Relationship
rel.description: The relationship of the content of the news object to the organisation

uri.title: URI
uri.description: The identifier of the organisation as a complete uri

literal.title: Literal
literal.description: An identifier for the organisation as a free-text string.

symbols.title: Symbols
symbols.description: Symbols used for a financial instrument linked to the organisation at a specific market place

ticker.title: Ticker
ticker.description: Ticker symbol used for the financial instrument

exchange.title: Exchange
exchange.description: Identifier for the marketplace which uses the ticker symbols of the ticker property

symbol.title: Symbol
symbol.description: Compare with hasInstrument in NewsML-G2. Same as symbol in G2.

places.title: Places
places.description: An array of named locations. nar:subject

rel.title: Relationship
rel.description: The relationship of the content of the news object to the place

uri.title: URI
uri.description: The identifier for the place as a complete uri

literal.title: Literal
literal.description: An identifier for the place as a free-text string.

subjects.title: Subjects
subjects.description: An array of objects holding concepts with a relationship to the content. nar:subject

rel.title: Relationship
rel.description: The relationship of the content of the news object to the subject

uri.title: URI
uri.description: The identifier of the subject as a complete uri

literal.title: Literal
literal.description: An identifier for the subject as a free-text string.

creator.title: Creator
creator.description: Specifies which entity (person, organisation or system) that has created or last edited the property.

relevance.title: Relevance
relevance.description: The relevance of the metadata to the news content to which it is attached.

confidence.title: Confidence
confidence.description: The confidence with which the metadata has been assigned.

events.title: Events
events.description: An array of objects describing something which happens in a planned or unplanned manner. nar:?

rel.title: Relationship
rel.description: The relationship of the content of the news object to the event

uri.title: URI
uri.description: The identifier for the event as a complete uri

literal.title: Literal
literal.description: An identifier for the event as a free-text string.

objects.title: Objects
objects.description: An array of objects describing something material, excluding persons. nar:subject

rel.title: Relationship
rel.description: The relationship of the content of the news object to the object

uri.title: URI
uri.description: The identifier for the object as a complete uri

literal.title: Literal
literal.description: An identifier for the object as a free-text string.

infosources.title: Info sources
infosources.description: An array of parties (person or organisation) which originated, modified, enhanced, distributed, aggregated or supplied the content or provided some information used to create or enhance the content. (Added in version 1.2 according to issue #15.) .    infosource:  nar:infoSource

role.title: Role
role.description: The role the infosource in relationship to the content as a uri.

uri.title: URI
uri.description: The identifier of the infosource as a complete uri

literal.title: Literal
literal.description: An identifier for the infosource as a free-text string.

title.title: Title
title.description: A short natural-language name for the item. Title is metadata, use headlines for publishable headlines. (Added in version 1.2 according to issue #9). nar:itemMeta/title

by.title: By
by.description: A natural-language statement about the creator (author, photographer etc.) of the content. nar:by

slugline.title: Slugline
slugline.description: A human-readable identifier for the item. (Added in version 1.2 from issue #4.). nar:slugline

located.title: Located
located.description: The name of the location from which the content originates. nar:located

renditions.title: Renditions
renditions.description: An array of objects with different renditions of the news object. nar:remoteContent

items.description: A specific rendition of the content of the news object. (Description changed in version 1.2 according to issue #17.)

name.title: Name
name.description: The name of this object in the array of renditions. For example 'thumbnail'

href.title: href
href.description: The URL for accessing the rendition as a resource. nar:remoteContent@ref

contenttype.title: Content Type
contenttype.description: A media type which applies to this rendition. nar:remoteContent@contenttype

title.title: Title
title.description: A title for the link to the rendition resource

height.title: Height
height.description: For still and moving images: the height of the display area measured in pixels. nar:remoteContent@height

width.title: Width
width.description: For still and moving images: the width of the display area measured in pixels. nar:remoteContent@width

sizeinbytes.title: Size in bytes
sizeinbytes.description: The size of the rendition resource in bytes

duration.title: Duration
duration.description: The total time duration of the content in seconds. (Added in version 1.2. Issue #18). nar:remoteContent@duration

format.title: Format
format.description: A refinement of a generic content type (i.e. IANA media type) by a literal string value. nar:remoteContent@contenttypevariant and nar:remoteContent@format

associations.title: Associations
associations.description: An array of objects with content of news objects which are associated with this news object.

items.description: Each associated object can use all properties in ninjs.

name.title: Name (of associated object)
name.description: Human-readable name of the associated object.

altids.title: Alternative ids
altids.description: Alternative identifiers assigned to the content. Each alternative id can have a role and a value. nar:altId issue #3.

role.title: Role
role.description: The role of the alternative id

trustindicators.title: Trust indicators
trustindicators.description: An array of objects to allow links to documents about trust indicators. issue #44. (Added in version 1.3)

role.title: Role
role.description: The role of the trust indicator as a complete uri

title.title: Title
title.description: The title of the resource being referenced.

href.title: href
href.description: The URL for accessing the trust indicator resource.

standard.title: Standard
standard.description: An object with information about standard, version and schema this instance is valid against. nar:standard, nar:standardversion and xml:schema issue #43. (Added in version 1.3)

schema.title: Schema
schema.description: The uri of the json schema to use for validation.

genres.title: Genres
genres.description: A nature, intellectual or journalistic form of the content. nar:genre. (Added in version 1.3)

uri.title: URI
uri.description: The identifier of  the genre as a complete uri

literal.title: Literal
literal.description: An identifier for the genre as a free-text string.

expires.title: Expires
expires.description: The date and time after which the Item is no longer considered editorially relevant by its provider. nar:expires (Added in 2.1)

rightsinfo.title: Rights information
rightsinfo.description: Expression of rights to be applied to content. nar:rightsInfo

langid.title: Language id
langid.description: Identifier for the Rights Expression language used. nar:@langid

linkedrights.title: Linked rights
linkedrights.description: A link from the current Item to Web resource with rights related information. nar:link

encodedrights.title: Encoded Rights
encodedrights.description: Contains a rights expression as defined by a Rights Expression Language. nar:rightsExpressionXML or nar:rightsExpressionData
